resources.string: NAUTICUS inspires and educates with engaging & interactive experiences that celebrate our connections with today\'s maritime world. Nauticus is a contemporary museum that uses the natural setting of Norfolk\'s harbor to showcase global maritime commerce and the world\'s largest Navy.

Berthed at Nauticus, the Battleship Wisconsin is one of the largest and last battleships ever built by the U.S. Navy. Explore its deck through a self-guided tour or, with an additional charge, our guided Topside Tour that will take you back in time to experience this majestic ship that earned five battle stars during WW II.

The Hampton Roads Naval Museum is an accredited museum operated by the United States Navy that celebrates the over 240 year history of the fleet in the Hampton Roads region of Virginia. We are located on the second floor of Nauticus in beautiful downtown Norfolk, Virginia.

The Power of the Sea Galleries encompass the entire 3rd floor event area of Nauticus, including the Living Sea Landing, the Wisconsin Vista, and the Living Sea Theater. Maximum seated capacity of 350.
In this area you can enjoy the breathtaking view of the Battleship Wisconsin through large picture windows. This area also includes a variety of computer interactives.

The Living Sea Landing features Horseshoe Crab Cove, a simulated tide pool where your guests can interact with many of the Chesapeake Bay marine life. It is also home to the Shark Experience, and interactive shark tank filled with a variety of friendly sharks. The area accommodates 110 seated guests or 250 standing.
With seating for up to 350 people, this location is ideal for presentations, performances and award ceremonies. It features a large format screen.
The Lighthouse Portico is Nauticusâ€™s expansive front entrance deck, with access to the waterfront. Cool breezes off the river make this a delightful area to entertain.

This outdoor covered event area offers up beautiful views of the Elizabeth River, as well as protection from inclement weather. With a seated capacity of 550 and a standing capacity of 900, it is the largest event area on the Nauticus grounds. Add in the parking lot and capacity increases to 1200 standing.

The MacArthur Memorial is a museum and research center dedicated to preserving and presenting the story of the life of General of the Army Douglas MacArthur. The Memorial also pays tribute to the millions of men and women who served with General MacArthur in World War I, World War II, and the Korean War.

The Chrysler Museum of Art is a rare gem, with small but inspirational collections of art and antiquities, all well laid out in a lovely building, newly renovated in 2014. This free museum has one of the country\'s leading glass collections. Even visitors who are not interested in art cannot help but be impressed by the beauty and creativity found in this collection. In addition, the museum features European and American painting and sculpture, modern art, contemporary art, photography, decorative arts, and ancient art. From Henri Matisse to Andy Warhol, the museum\'s permanent collection offers a bit of everything, and temporary exhibitions ensure return visits are in order. \n \nNext door to the main museum is the Chrysler Museum Glass Studio, where artists come to work at their craft, and guests can see demonstrations in glass blowing. Classes and workshops are also available.
Historic home and picturesque gardens offering a fine art collection, professional program and classes.
The Norfolk Botanical Garden is a botanical garden with an arboretum located at 6700 Azalea Garden Road, Norfolk, Virginia.

The Virginia Zoological Park is a 53-acre zoo located adjacent to Lafayette Park in Norfolk, Virginia, United States. The zoo opened in 1900, and was accredited by the Association of Zoos and Aquariums in 1987.

Docked in downtown Norfolk, not far from Nauticus, is the tall ship, American Rover. This three-masted schooner offers sailing cruises on the Elizabeth River and Hampton Roads Harbor, with fantastic views of the city and surroundings. These narrated cruises last an hour and a half to two hours and run from April to October. Guests can help with the sailing if they want a little hands-on experience, or simply enjoy the ride. Snacks and beverages are sold on the ship, but guests are also welcome to bring their own food on with them if they choose. Cruises can be booked 30 days in advance, but it is often possible to get tickets at the last minute. Afternoon and sunset cruises are available, and occasionally special sailings are scheduled, including night cruises.

Located in the heart of downtown Norfolk, Town Point Park provides seven acres of peaceful green space along the Elizabeth River. Town Point Park is Norfolk\'s premier waterfront entertainment venue and serves as a destination for signature festivals, cultural and educational events.

This unique 6.5-acre beach park, is considered the jewel of Ocean View. The park has a large band shell for presentations and dancing, a beach with lifeguards in the summer, a boardwalk, beach handicap access ramp, and lots of open green space.
Comfy, time-tested option serving pizza, pasta and other Italian comfort food, plus beer and wine.
Italian and Greek dishes meet pizza and burgers in a casual, paneled tavern with sports photos and TVs.
Delivery, Dine In, Pick Up and Catering Breakfast, Pizza, Stromboli, Calzones, Salads, Wings, Pasta, Dinners, Desserts, Catering and more for entire Family.
Understated joint dishing up classic pizzas, hearty pasta dishes and other Italian comfort foods.
Landmark stop since 1904 serving BBQ, burgers, dogs and sandwiches plus soda fountain favorites.
Tiny breakfast and lunch joint serving a variety of sweet-potato biscuit sandwiches, sides and desserts.

This application shows various locations of interest in Norfolk, Virgina. \n \nSwipe from the left side of the screen to open a drawer from which you may select various categories of locations of interest: parks, museums, military locations, restaurants, and other locations.
Click the icons to control the player
Acquires location data for the NorfolkTouring app.
NorfolkTouring needs to access this device\'s location to determine distance from touring locations.
